Now as to the latter of these, It is also certain and directly connected with it, That any man whatsoever, through the be- nefit of the death of Christ, may claim to himself this right, that if he should believe, immediately all his sins are blot- ted out, and he is adopted as an heir of eternal life. For although on account of the want of fulfilment of the condition many cannot actually claim these promised blessings, yet there is no human being to whom they would not ab-ound by virtue of the death of Christ, if the condi- tion were fulfilled by him.
